# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

Here is a possible implementation of the `clean_column` function:
```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    # Lowercase the column name
    lowered = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip any leading or trailing whitespaces
    trimmed = strip(lowered)
    
    # Replace any spaces and hyphens with an underscore
    replaced = replace(trimmed, r"[ -]" => "_")
    
    return replaced
end
```
This function takes a column name as input (`col`), lowercases it using the `lowercase` function, strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using the `strip` function, and replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore using the `replace` function. The resulting string is then returned by the function.

Note that this implementation uses regular expressions to match any space or hyphen character in the input column name, and replaces them with an underscore. You can adjust the regular expression pattern as needed to suit your specific requirements.
